p: NAAT are very popular in the diagnosis and management of viral infections (HBV, HCV, HIV, Influenza viruses, …) because they allow determination of the viral load. In other terms, quantitation of the viral nucleic acid by amplifying the target sequence thousands-fold. In most cases, they are now considered a reference, or ‘gold standard’ method for diagnostic practices such as screening donated blood for transfusion-transmitted viruses (CMV, HIV, HCV, …) ( Jackson, 1990).
